comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Lost American Architecture, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 92934406@N00
comment._content: This became the location of the Hay-Adams hotel.

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: Beautiful photograph of the Hay-Adams house--the first one I've ever seen.   As the boxes added by Whitewall Buick indicate, the building comprised two residences: the diplomat and Secretary of State John Hay lived in one, and his friend and author Henry Adams lived in the other.  Adams, a descendant of two presidents and son of diplomat Charles Francis Adams, was born in Massachusetts but took up residence in Washington after the Civil War, when he was a young man.  He was the anonymous author of the political novel "Democracy" and a great observer of the social and political scene.   He lived in Washington the remainder of his life.
